function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Transmission of virus through aerosols and droplets during surgical and dental procedures as well as from infected patients while talking, coughing, and sneezing.","Impact":"Increased risk of virus transmission and infection for healthcare staff, patients, and individuals in the surrounding space.","Mitigation":"Use appropriate protective equipment, implement infection control training, and adopt strict precautions for all hospital workers.","Technologies":"Protective equipment like masks, gloves, and face shields, and air purification systems.","People":"Healthcare staff, postoperational patients, dental patients, hospital workers, and individuals in the surrounding space.","Owner":"Hospital administrators, infection control specialists, and healthcare workers."},{"Description":"Virus transmission through contaminated surfaces (fomites) and the viability of the virus in aerosols for up to 3 hours and on different surfaces for 4-72 hours.","Impact":"Risk of virus transmission to those touching contaminated surfaces, leading to potential infection.","Mitigation":"Implement strict cleaning and disinfection protocols, provide adequate protective devices, and infection control training for hospital workers.","Technologies":"Cleaning and disinfection agents, UV disinfection systems, and air purification systems.","People":"Hospital workers, patients, visitors, and individuals in the surrounding space.","Owner":"Hospital administrators, infection control specialists, and cleaning staff."},{"Description":"Potential transmission of the virus through the gastrointestinal tract.","Impact":"Increased risk of transmission through the fecal-oral route, leading to potential infection in individuals.","Mitigation":"Implement strict hygiene and sanitation measures, provide infection control training for healthcare staff, and conduct regular testing and monitoring.","Technologies":"Sanitation and hygiene products, wastewater treatment systems, and air purification systems.","People":"Healthcare staff, individuals in close contact with COVID-19 positive cases, and individuals in the surrounding space.","Owner":"Public health authorities, hospital administrators, and sanitation specialists."}]}
